trans-unit.source: PowerShell for StorSimple device management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: PowerShell for StorSimple device management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to manage your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to manage your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple provides a command-line interface that you can use to manage your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple provides a command-line interface that you can use to manage your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: As the name suggests, it is a Windows PowerShell-based, command-line interface that is built in a constrained runspace.
trans-unit.target: As the name suggests, it is a Windows PowerShell-based, command-line interface that is built in a constrained runspace.

trans-unit.source: From the perspective of the user at the command line, a constrained runspace appears as a restricted version of Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: From the perspective of the user at the command line, a constrained runspace appears as a restricted version of Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: While maintaining some of the basic capabilities of Windows PowerShell, this interface has additional dedicated cmdlets that are geared towards managing your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: While maintaining some of the basic capabilities of Windows PowerShell, this interface has additional dedicated cmdlets that are geared towards managing your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This article describes the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple features, including how you can connect to this interface, and contains links to step-by-step procedures or workflows that you can perform using this interface.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple features, including how you can connect to this interface, and contains links to step-by-step procedures or workflows that you can perform using this interface.

trans-unit.source: The workflows include how to register your device, configure the network interface on your device, install updates that require the device to be in maintenance mode, change the device state, and troubleshoot any issues that you may experience.
trans-unit.target: The workflows include how to register your device, configure the network interface on your device, install updates that require the device to be in maintenance mode, change the device state, and troubleshoot any issues that you may experience.

trans-unit.source: After reading this article, you will be able to:
trans-unit.target: After reading this article, you will be able to:

trans-unit.source: Connect to your StorSimple device using Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your StorSimple device using Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Administer your StorSimple device using Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Administer your StorSimple device using Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Get help in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Get help in Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple cmdlets allow you to manage your StorSimple device from a serial console or remotely via Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple cmdlets allow you to manage your StorSimple device from a serial console or remotely via Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: For more information about each of the individual cmdlets that can be used in this interface, go to <linkText>cmdlet reference for Windows PowerShell for StorSimple</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about each of the individual cmdlets that can be used in this interface, go to <linkText>cmdlet reference for Windows PowerShell for StorSimple</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Azure PowerShell StorSimple cmdlets are a different collection of cmdlets that allow you to automate StorSimple service-level and migration tasks from the command line.
trans-unit.target: The Azure PowerShell StorSimple cmdlets are a different collection of cmdlets that allow you to automate StorSimple service-level and migration tasks from the command line.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure PowerShell cmdlets for StorSimple, go to the <linkText>Azure StorSimple cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure PowerShell cmdlets for StorSimple, go to the <linkText>Azure StorSimple cmdlet reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can access the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple using one of the following methods:
trans-unit.target: You can access the Windows PowerShell for StorSimple using one of the following methods:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect to StorSimple device serial console</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect to StorSimple device serial console</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect remotely to StorSimple using Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect remotely to StorSimple using Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can <linkText>download PuTTY</linkText><title></title> or similar terminal emulation software to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: You can <linkText>download PuTTY</linkText><title></title> or similar terminal emulation software to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: You need to configure PuTTY specifically to access the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: You need to configure PuTTY specifically to access the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The following topics contain detailed steps about how to configure PuTTy and connect to the device.
trans-unit.target: The following topics contain detailed steps about how to configure PuTTy and connect to the device.

trans-unit.source: Various menu options in the serial console are also explained.
trans-unit.target: Various menu options in the serial console are also explained.

trans-unit.source: When you access the Windows PowerShell interface of your StorSimple device through the serial console, a banner message is presented, followed by menu options.
trans-unit.target: When you access the Windows PowerShell interface of your StorSimple device through the serial console, a banner message is presented, followed by menu options.

trans-unit.source: The banner message contains basic StorSimple device information such as the model, name, installed software version, and status of the controller you are accessing.
trans-unit.target: The banner message contains basic StorSimple device information such as the model, name, installed software version, and status of the controller you are accessing.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows an example of a banner message.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows an example of a banner message.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Serial banner message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Serial banner message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can use the banner message to identify whether the controller you are connected to is Active or Passive.
trans-unit.target: You can use the banner message to identify whether the controller you are connected to is Active or Passive.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the various runspace options that are available in the serial console menu.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the various runspace options that are available in the serial console menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Register your device 2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Register your device 2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can choose from the following settings:
trans-unit.target: You can choose from the following settings:

trans-unit.source: Log in with full access This option allows you to connect (with the proper credentials) to the SSAdminConsole runspace on the local controller.
trans-unit.target: Log in with full access This option allows you to connect (with the proper credentials) to the SSAdminConsole runspace on the local controller.

trans-unit.source: (The local controller is the controller that you are currently accessing through the serial console of your StorSimple device.)
trans-unit.target: (The local controller is the controller that you are currently accessing through the serial console of your StorSimple device.)

trans-unit.source: This option can also be used to allow Microsoft Support to access unrestricted runspace (a support session) to troubleshoot any possible device issues.
trans-unit.target: This option can also be used to allow Microsoft Support to access unrestricted runspace (a support session) to troubleshoot any possible device issues.

trans-unit.source: After you use option 1 to log on, you can allow the Microsoft Support engineer to access unrestricted runspace by running a specific cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: After you use option 1 to log on, you can allow the Microsoft Support engineer to access unrestricted runspace by running a specific cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For details, refer to <linkText>Start a support session</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details, refer to <linkText>Start a support session</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This option connects to a runspace on the local controller.
trans-unit.target: This option connects to a runspace on the local controller.

trans-unit.source: Log in to peer controller with full access This option is the same as option 1, except that you can connect (with the proper credentials) to the SSAdminConsole runspace on the peer controller.
trans-unit.target: Log in to peer controller with full access This option is the same as option 1, except that you can connect (with the proper credentials) to the SSAdminConsole runspace on the peer controller.

trans-unit.source: Because the StorSimple device is a high availability device with two controllers in an active-passive configuration, peer refers to the other controller in the device that you are accessing through the serial console).
trans-unit.target: Because the StorSimple device is a high availability device with two controllers in an active-passive configuration, peer refers to the other controller in the device that you are accessing through the serial console).

trans-unit.source: Similar to option 1, this option can also be used to allow Microsoft Support to access unrestricted runspace on a peer controller.
trans-unit.target: Similar to option 1, this option can also be used to allow Microsoft Support to access unrestricted runspace on a peer controller.

trans-unit.source: Connect with limited access This option is used to access Windows PowerShell interface in limited mode.
trans-unit.target: Connect with limited access This option is used to access Windows PowerShell interface in limited mode.

trans-unit.source: You are not prompted for access credentials.
trans-unit.target: You are not prompted for access credentials.

trans-unit.source: This option connects to a more restricted runspace compared to options 1 and 2.
trans-unit.target: This option connects to a more restricted runspace compared to options 1 and 2.

trans-unit.source: Some of the tasks that are available through option 1 that cannot be performed in this runspace are:
trans-unit.target: Some of the tasks that are available through option 1 that cannot be performed in this runspace are:

trans-unit.source: Reset to the factory settings
trans-unit.target: Reset to the factory settings

trans-unit.source: Change the password
trans-unit.target: Change the password

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable support access
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable support access

trans-unit.source: Apply updates
trans-unit.target: Apply updates

trans-unit.source: Install hotfixes
trans-unit.target: Install hotfixes

trans-unit.source: This is the preferred option if you have forgotten the device administrator password and cannot connect through option 1 or 2.
trans-unit.target: This is the preferred option if you have forgotten the device administrator password and cannot connect through option 1 or 2.

trans-unit.source: Change language This option allows you to change the display language on the Windows PowerShell interface.
trans-unit.target: Change language This option allows you to change the display language on the Windows PowerShell interface.

trans-unit.source: The languages supported are English, Japanese, Russian, French, South Korean, Spanish, Italian, German, Chinese, and Brazilian Portuguese.
trans-unit.target: The languages supported are English, Japanese, Russian, French, South Korean, Spanish, Italian, German, Chinese, and Brazilian Portuguese.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you use the following PuTTY settings to connect to the Windows PowerShell interface from the serial console.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you use the following PuTTY settings to connect to the Windows PowerShell interface from the serial console.

trans-unit.source: In the PuTTY Reconfiguration dialog box, in the Category pane, select Keyboard.
trans-unit.target: In the PuTTY Reconfiguration dialog box, in the Category pane, select Keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the following options are selected (these are the default settings when you start a new session).
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the following options are selected (these are the default settings when you start a new session).

trans-unit.source: |Keyboard item|Select| |---|---| |Backspace key|Control-?
trans-unit.target: |Keyboard item|Select| |---|---| |Backspace key|Control-?

trans-unit.source: (127)| |Home and End keys|Standard| |Function keys and keypad|ESC[n~| |Initial state of cursor keys|Normal| |Initial state of numeric keypad|Normal| |Enable extra keyboard features|Control-Alt is different from AltGr|
trans-unit.target: (127)| |Home and End keys|Standard| |Function keys and keypad|ESC[n~| |Initial state of cursor keys|Normal| |Initial state of numeric keypad|Normal| |Enable extra keyboard features|Control-Alt is different from AltGr|

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Supported Putty Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Supported Putty Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply.

trans-unit.source: In the Category pane, select Translation.
trans-unit.target: In the Category pane, select Translation.

trans-unit.source: In the Remote character set list box, select UTF-8.
trans-unit.target: In the Remote character set list box, select UTF-8.

trans-unit.source: Under Handling of line drawing characters, select Use Unicode line drawing code points.
trans-unit.target: Under Handling of line drawing characters, select Use Unicode line drawing code points.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows the correct PuTTY selections.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows the correct PuTTY selections.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>UTF Putty Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>UTF Putty Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply.

trans-unit.source: You can now use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console by doing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: You can now use PuTTY to connect to the device serial console by doing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: You can use Windows PowerShell remoting to connect to your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: You can use Windows PowerShell remoting to connect to your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: When you connect this way, you will not see a menu.
trans-unit.target: When you connect this way, you will not see a menu.

trans-unit.source: (You see a menu only if you use the serial console on the device to connect.)
trans-unit.target: (You see a menu only if you use the serial console on the device to connect.)

trans-unit.source: With Windows PowerShell remoting, you connect to a specific runspace.
trans-unit.target: With Windows PowerShell remoting, you connect to a specific runspace.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify the display language.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify the display language.

trans-unit.source: The display language is independent of the language that you set by using the Change Language option in the serial console menu.
trans-unit.target: The display language is independent of the language that you set by using the Change Language option in the serial console menu.

trans-unit.source: Remote PowerShell will automatically pick up the locale of the device you are connecting from if none is specified.
trans-unit.target: Remote PowerShell will automatically pick up the locale of the device you are connecting from if none is specified.

trans-unit.source: If you are working with Microsoft Azure virtual hosts and StorSimple virtual devices, you can use Windows PowerShell remoting and the virtual host to connect to the virtual device.
trans-unit.target: If you are working with Microsoft Azure virtual hosts and StorSimple virtual devices, you can use Windows PowerShell remoting and the virtual host to connect to the virtual device.

trans-unit.source: If you have set up a share location on the host on which to save information from the Windows PowerShell session you should be aware that the Everyone principal includes only authenticated users.
trans-unit.target: If you have set up a share location on the host on which to save information from the Windows PowerShell session you should be aware that the Everyone principal includes only authenticated users.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if you have set the share up to allow access by Everyone and you connect without specifying credentials, the unauthenticated Anonymous principal will be used and you will see an error.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if you have set the share up to allow access by Everyone and you connect without specifying credentials, the unauthenticated Anonymous principal will be used and you will see an error.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, on the share host you must enable the Guest account and then give the Guest account full access to the share or you must specify valid credentials along with the Windows PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, on the share host you must enable the Guest account and then give the Guest account full access to the share or you must specify valid credentials along with the Windows PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You can use HTTP or HTTPS to connect via Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: You can use HTTP or HTTPS to connect via Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: Use the instructions in the following tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Use the instructions in the following tutorials:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect remotely using http</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect remotely using http</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Connect remotely using https</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Connect remotely using https</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: When you are deciding how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, consider the following:
trans-unit.target: When you are deciding how to connect to Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, consider the following:

trans-unit.source: Connecting directly to the device serial console is secure but connecting to the serial console over network switches is not.
trans-unit.target: Connecting directly to the device serial console is secure but connecting to the serial console over network switches is not.

trans-unit.source: Be cautious of the security risk when connecting to device serial over network switches.
trans-unit.target: Be cautious of the security risk when connecting to device serial over network switches.

trans-unit.source: Connecting through an HTTP session might offer more security than connecting through the serial console over network.
trans-unit.target: Connecting through an HTTP session might offer more security than connecting through the serial console over network.

trans-unit.source: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.
trans-unit.target: Although this is not the most secure method, it is acceptable on trusted networks.

trans-unit.source: Connecting through an HTTPS session with a self-signed certificate is the most secure and the recommended option.
trans-unit.target: Connecting through an HTTPS session with a self-signed certificate is the most secure and the recommended option.

trans-unit.target: The following table shows a summary of all the common management tasks and complex workflows that can be performed within the Windows PowerShell interface of your StorSimple device.For more information about each workflow, click the appropriate entry in the table.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, cmdlet Help is available.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell for StorSimple, cmdlet Help is available.

trans-unit.source: An online, up-to-date version of this Help is also available, which you can use to update the Help on your system.
trans-unit.target: An online, up-to-date version of this Help is also available, which you can use to update the Help on your system.

trans-unit.source: Getting Help in this interface is similar to that in Windows PowerShell, and most of the Help-related cmdlets will work.
trans-unit.target: Getting Help in this interface is similar to that in Windows PowerShell, and most of the Help-related cmdlets will work.

trans-unit.source: You can find Help for Windows PowerShell online in the TechNet Library: <linkText>Scripting with Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can find Help for Windows PowerShell online in the TechNet Library: <linkText>Scripting with Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following is a brief description of the types of Help for this Windows PowerShell interface, including how to update the Help.
trans-unit.target: The following is a brief description of the types of Help for this Windows PowerShell interface, including how to update the Help.

trans-unit.source: To get Help for any cmdlet or function, use the following command: Get-Help
trans-unit.target: To get Help for any cmdlet or function, use the following command: Get-Help

trans-unit.source: To get online Help for any cmdlet, use the previous cmdlet with the -Online parameter: Get-Help -Online
trans-unit.target: To get online Help for any cmdlet, use the previous cmdlet with the -Online parameter: Get-Help -Online

trans-unit.source: For full Help, you can use the –Full parameter, and for examples, use the –Examples parameter.
trans-unit.target: For full Help, you can use the –Full parameter, and for examples, use the –Examples parameter.

trans-unit.source: You can easily update the Help in the Windows PowerShell interface.
trans-unit.target: You can easily update the Help in the Windows PowerShell interface.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to update the Help on your system.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to update the Help on your system.

trans-unit.source: Start Windows PowerShell with the Run as administrator option.
trans-unit.target: Start Windows PowerShell with the Run as administrator option.

trans-unit.source: At the command prompt, type: Update-Help
trans-unit.target: At the command prompt, type: Update-Help

trans-unit.source: The updated Help files will be installed.
trans-unit.target: The updated Help files will be installed.

trans-unit.source: After the Help files are installed, type: Get-Help Get-Command.
trans-unit.target: After the Help files are installed, type: Get-Help Get-Command.

trans-unit.source: This will display a list of cmdlets for which Help is available.
trans-unit.target: This will display a list of cmdlets for which Help is available.

trans-unit.source: To get a list of all the available cmdlets in any of the runspaces, log in to the corresponding menu option and run the Get-Command cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To get a list of all the available cmdlets in any of the runspaces, log in to the corresponding menu option and run the Get-Command cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: If you experience any issues with your StorSimple device when performing one of the above workflows, refer to <linkText>Tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you experience any issues with your StorSimple device when performing one of the above workflows, refer to <linkText>Tools for troubleshooting StorSimple deployments</linkText><title></title>.
